title: THAI and Citi Celebrate the Expansion of THAI's A380 fleet
summary: Bangkok - Citi congratulated THAI on the continued expansion of their fleet of Airbus A380s. Building upon their strong partnership spanning over a decade, Citi Country Officer and Country Head Darren Buckley said: "Citi is delighted to play a role in this monumental occasion for THAI. The Airbus A380 heralds a new era of efficient and technologically advanced aircraft, enabling THAI to provide world-class service to its customers on key Asian and Intercontinental routes. Over Citi's 200 year history, we have stood for progress, backing such initiatives as uniform cargo containers, the development of the commercial airliner, pioneering the ATM and launching Thailand's first broadband satellite. Citi's partnership with THAI's A380 expansion marks yet another proud milestone in that history."

The Airbus A380 heralds a new era of efficient and technologically advanced aircraft, enabling THAI to provide world-class service to its customers on key Asian and Intercontinental routes. Over Citi's 200 year history, we have stood for progress, backing such initiatives as uniform cargo containers, the development of the commercial airliner, pioneering the ATM and launching Thailand's first broadband satellite. tag-3: Thai Airways International President Sorajak Kasemsuvan said: "THAI is pleased to partner with Citi for the expansion of our A380 fleet. By constantly updating our fleet, we are able to offer our customers five-star service in terms of comfort, safety and amenities. The introduction of the Airbus A380 to our fleet demonstrates our commitment to our loyal customers, and we thank Citi for assisting us in making this happen. THAI has become the ninth airline to introduce the world's largest passenger aircraft, and we look forward to having all six THAI A380s in service by the end of next year. This growth underscores our partnership with Citi that has lasted over a decade, and we look forward to continuing this strong relationship in the future."
